main.name: Mitchell L. Dang
main.description: Hi! I'm Mitchell, a growing CS major at University of Washington Bothell, Fullstack developer, and mountain biker.
main.skills: ReactJS, HTML, CSS/SCSS, Python, Stripe, Django, NodeJS, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, AWS, Azure, C#/.NET, Google Apps Script

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science & Software Engineering
education.description: Studies applied computer science and software design

education.degree: Associate Degree in Integrated Studies, President’s Honor Graduate.
education.description: Associate degree in Integrated Studies and computer science fundamentals

work.title: Frontend Developer
work.description: Attend agile development cycle. Design intuitive UI/UX. Utilize React.js to develop features for booking system and payment that communicate with the backend written in Django. Report bugs and collaborate with the backend team to fix them. Technologies: Git, Stripe, React.js, HTML, Sass, Photoshop, Figma, APIs, Google Cloud Platform, Python.

work.company: Association for Computing Machinery Chapter at University of Washington Bothell
work.title: Web developer | Event Coordinator
work.description: Maintain and develop website for club events. Technologies: Git, HTML, XML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap 4.5, Git. Co-host UWB ACM – Allen Institute for Brain Science programming contest UWBCode 2020 on HackerRank with 100+ contestants from colleges in the Pacific Northwest.

projects.title: Generating Hints for Programming Problems Without a Solution
projects.subTitle: ACM SIGCSE 2021 Research Paper
projects.description: A neural network model for learning and solving coding problems with BERT. Solutions has the accuracy up to 75%. The paper is presented at ACM SIGCSE 2021

projects.title: MyGuru
projects.subTitle: Web app
projects.description: A simple application hosted on Azure allowing users to retrieve weather data and fun facts in a specific location imported from its web interface. Data for the application is fetched from OpenWeather, Wikipedia

projects.title: Leet Programming
projects.subTitle: Improve CS Education
projects.description: Prepared lessons for Leet Programming, an algorithm course on Stepik with 140+ learners to enhance CS Education led by UWB Dr. Yusuf Pisan

projects.title: Complete Bus System (CBS)
projects.description: Created a scalable relational database for public transportation hosted on AWS. CBS supports transit companies in managing employees and routes

projects.title: The Rubic Shoes
projects.subTitle: Better for people with visual impairment. Honored in Embedded System, Vietnam Science & Engineering Fair
projects.description: Created smart shoes to resolve visual impairment-related issues. Improved user’s motion by at least 5% by utilizing echolocation technology. The shoes send out warning sounds and vibration for possible obstacles within 12 feet, effective angle +/- 15 degree
